bibl.title: Aristophanes on a Bank Receipt (?).
bibl.note: O. Tait Bodl. 279 (= Pack2 2780) is a palimpsest (first century B.C.?) over a nearly effaced Ptolemaic bank receipt (?) from Thebes (?). The text has been labelled "unidentified prose"; in fact it is taken from Aristophanes, Clouds (974-975). Interprets the quotation in the light of the terracotta figures of the naked boy-god Harpocrates.
LITINAS Nikos, Aristophanes on a Bank Receipt (?).
